Description: Lev's 13 Electronics &#183 Tools &#183 Games &#183 & More Shop Our Other Auctions View Our Feedback OLP Ernie Ball Double Neck Electric Guitar 6 and 12 String Electric Model: MM613 Quilted Look Tobacco Sunburst OLP (Officially Licensed Products) produced many unique sounding, quality, guitars for many companies over the years. In the early 2000's they produced multiple lines for Ernie Ball under exacting specifications. This model MM612 is used, and is a rare version produced for Ernie Ball in the quilted top look double neck in 6 and 12 string configurations. In overall very good to excellent condition, this fine solid body electric has very few signs of use and play. There are some minor signs of prior use and some minor cosmetic blemishing such as minor finish mars and typical flaws, but overall this is one pristine guitar and it is obvious that it spent the vast majority of its life safely tucked away in its padded gig bag. This fine electric guitar is easily switchable between 6, 12, or simultaneous modes. both necks are easily playable with great sound, easy action, and good intonation. Comes as shown (guitar only) but does include the original padded gig bag in fair condition (not shown). From the Website: The OLP MM612 Double Neck Electric Guitar is a 6- and 12-string double neck guitar with high-quality construction, tone, and appearance! Features a basswood body with quilt film maple top, bolt-on North American maple necks, and maple fingerboards with 22 jumbo frets. 2 direct-mounted OLP humbuckers for each axe, fixed bridges. 25-1/2" scale. This guitar was part of the Ernie Ball Music Man budget line before the creation of Sterling By Music Man (SBMM). This is a double neck 6/12 string version of the Axis/EVH Signature, it looks more like a Wolfgang at first glance. Title: OLP EVH/Axis Style Doubleneck MM612 Double Neck Electric Guitar 6 & 12 String
ConditionDescription: In overall very good to excellent used condition with typical sings of light use and play such as minor cosmetic  blemishes, minor finish blemishes, and evidence of play on the fingerboards.  Overall very pristine.  Sounds great plays nice.
